              Arnaud Natal

                        ORCID
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        NEEMSIS page
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            
            Hi! Welcome to my page!
            I am a Ph.D. Student at the Economics departement (BSE) of the
            University of Bordeaux in France, and affiliated to the the
            French Institute of
            Pondicherry (IFP) in India, through the Observatory of Rural
            Dynamics and Inequalities in South India (ODRIIS).
            I am currently in India until August 2023.
            My main fields of interest are Development Economics, and
            I work on topics related to household indebtedness, labour
            market, and cognitive skills/personality traits in rural
            South India, using the RUME
            and NEEMSIS
            datasets.
            Under the supervision of Christophe Jalil Nordman
            (LEDa-DIAL, IRD) and Éric Rougier (BSE), my thesis is
            (temporarily) titled Essays on debt in rural South
            India.
            Check below the making-of of the NEEMSIS survey!
            
            
            
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Arnaud Natal

articles.title: Project
articles.contents:
Contents
Observatory
of Rural Dynamics and Inequalities in South India

Observatory
of Rural Dynamics and Inequalities in South India
Coordinated by Dr
Isabelle Guérin and Dr
Christophe J. Nordman, the ODRIIS Observatory is housed by the
research program “Household vulnerabilities, labour and socioeconomic
dynamics” in the Social Departments of the French Institute of
Pondicherry. ODRIIS aims to analyses how structural changes in
contemporary India are reshaping the organisation of work, social
hierarchies and household livelihoods. The observatory combines
different tools through a collection of projects to help understand
these socio-economic changes under different lights. We have been
collecting quantitative panel data on households and individuals in
rural South India via the NEEMSIS Survey. We also use a variety of
socio-economic methods (financial diaries, village monographs, life
stories, video documentaries, etc). Beyond the regional analysis, the
ODRIIS Observatory intends to contribute to the theoretical renewal of
the concepts of work, networks, skills, debt and financialisation.



Figure 1: Family from Manapakkam, India.
